args: Pardon me, Your Highness, but might\nI borrow your ear for a moment?
I went to the village earlier to do some\nshopping, and I fear I heard some rather\ndisturbing rumors about Victor.

People are saying the leader of the
Shadewolves yet lives, and that he
uses cruel and brutal methods to
enact revenge on Empire soldiers.
Yep. Folks say he torched an entire village\nwhat just to kill a few imperial soldiers.
Apparently this man also poisoned a well,\nkilling an imperial garrison along with the\nentire village where they were stationed.
He's killing entire villages of people\njust to get to the soldiers?!
I can't believe Victor would resort\nto such horrific methods.
Far as I knew, the Shadewolves had a\ncode what strictly forbade 'em from\nhurtin' civilians. But this stuff...
It has long been said that a thirst for\nrevenge can change a person.
I don't want these stories to be true.\nI want to believe in Victor.
Then what say we head out and see if\nthey're just a bunch'a words in the wind?
How do you propose we do so?
Pull up a chair, boss.\nI got me an idea...
Forgive my dropping in unannounced,\nbut is this the home of Tomas's parents?
A'yup, I'm his papa. And who're you?
My name is Victor, and I am the\nleader of the Shadewolves.
I'm afraid I come bearing ill news.
'Bout m'son? We already know.\nWord travels fast these days,\neven all the way out here.
You have my most sincere apologies\nand condolences, sir. I wish to—
All the bowin' and scrapin' in the world\nwon't bring m'boy back, so ya might\nas well lift yer head.
I know who you are!\nYou stole my son from me!
I beg your forgiveness, madam.\nI take full responsibility as his commander.
This is the compensation due your son.\nI know it cannot make up for his loss,\nbut it is at least—
Monster! What need have I of money when\nmy only boy lies alone in the cold ground?!
Father, it is rude to leave a guest\nstanding out in the—
This man's no guest of ours—and he\nwas just leavin'. Now take mother and\nget her inside while we finish up.
Come, let's get inside before\nyou catch your death of cold.
It's okay, Gramma! I'll protect you\njust like Papa used to!
I've heard tales a'plenty 'bout you, sir.\nIs that your way of atonin' fer this?
M'son is dead, but you ain't yet.\nMight think of treatin' that precious\ngift with a bit more care in the future.
The Empire stole everything from me.\nAny reason I may have had for living\nis now dedicated to seeing them pay.
I got me a reason for livin' too—\nthat little boy. He's all I got left\nof the son what was stolen away.
And that boy'll never be a man like you.\nHe'll never fight for coin. That's a promise.
Now be on yer way, and never\ndarken our door again.
...So Victor went to the home of a\nfallen comrade and gave money to\nthe grieving family?
The Shadewolves were known for their\nbrotherhood. Hell, that kinda pack unity\ngave 'em the name in the first place.
I'd fight like a demon for a man\nlike that, I tell ya what.
I wasn't very enthusiastic about the idea\nof following Victor like this, spying on\nwhat he's doing...
But at least we saw he's not the inhuman\nmonster some of the rumors are making\nhim out to be.
If he truly loved his comrades so,\nit makes his desire for vengeance\nmore understandable.
Understandable, yes—but I don't know\nif it makes it RIGHT.
